alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued October 25 at 8:33PM CDT until October 30 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Trempealeau River at Dodge affecting Buffalo and Trempealeau Counties. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING TO MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Trempealeau River at Dodge. * WHEN...From Saturday evening to Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, The railroad bridge about three quarters of a mile upstream from the gage can restrict the flow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Saturday evening. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 845 AM CDT.
